code:
# Magic Dedicated Wallet Facebook Social Login

Please [click here](https://magic.link/docs/authentication/features/social-logins/social-providers/facebook) for full implementation instructions
explanation: This block enables a dedicated wallet with Facebook social login functionality, allowing users to authenticate through their Facebook account.
repository_explanation:
This repository is a demonstration of Facebook OAuth implementation using Magic Labs.

It showcases how to authenticate users with Facebook and provide access to their data in a controlled manner.
file_summary:
Here is a concise summary:

**README.md Summary**

Enables dedicated wallet with Facebook social login, allowing users to authenticate via their Facebook account.

    <meta charset="utf-8" />
    <link rel="icon" href="%PUBLIC_URL%/favicon.ico" />
    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1" />
    <meta name="theme-color" content="#000000" />
    <meta
      name="description"
      content="Web site created using create-react-app"
    />
    <link rel="apple-touch-icon" href="%PUBLIC_URL%/logo192.png" />
    <!--
      manifest.json provides metadata used when your web app is installed on a
      user's mobile device or desktop. See https://developers.google.com/web/fundamentals/web-app-manifest/
    -->
    <link rel="manifest" href="%PUBLIC_URL%/manifest.json" />
    <!--
      Notice the use of %PUBLIC_URL% in the tags above.
      It will be replaced with the URL of the `public` folder during the build.
      Only files inside the `public` folder can be referenced from the HTML.

explanation:
This block of code defines a set of styles for an application's UI, including:

* Font imports and settings
* Global styles for HTML and body elements (e.g., margins, font sizes)
* Styles for specific components such as:
	+ The main app container (.App)
	+ Headings (h1) and buttons
	+ A loading message (.loading)
	+ Logout button
	+ Container and user info elements

Here is a concise summary of the file 'src/lib/magic.js':

**Magic.js Library Initialization**

Initializes the Magic.js library with OAuth extension for authentication, creating a Magic.js instance with an API key and enabling OAuth login functionality.

explanation:
Here is a concise summary:

**Purpose:** A React functional component that handles social login using Magic, displays user data, and provides a logout feature.

**Functionality:**

* Tries to retrieve user data on mount
* Displays "Loading..." until user data is available
* Shows user data in JSON format once retrieved
* Logs out the user when button is clicked

explanation:

**Functionality:** A React component that redirects users to Facebook for authentication, then logs them into an application (dashboard) upon successful authorization.

file_summary:
Here is a concise holistic summary of the file 'src/pages/Login.js':

**Login Page Summary**

The Login page provides social login functionality using Facebook, redirecting users to authenticate with Facebook and subsequently logging them into the application dashboard upon successful authorization.
